results.title: Speaking of animals: down on the farm
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Jerry Fairbanks, Tex Avery and Lou Lilly
results.brief_description: Animated novelty film about farm animals including pigs, cows, chickens, ducks, sheep etc blended with live action footage and voice-overs to give animals a “human personality”.

results.title: Speaking of animals
results.creator_credit: Jerry Fairbanks Productions and Jerry Fairbanks
results.brief_description: A selection of short films and excerpts from the forties that apply visual effects to live action footage of animals so they appear to be talking and singing. While some segments are mildly amusing, the ones that feature monkeys performing humiliating tricks are less so. “Who’s who in animal land” and “And their families” won Academy Awards for Best Short Feature.

results.title: Speaking object-ly
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Yaletown Productions Inc., John Taylor, George Johnson and Don White
results.brief_description: This film explores the concept that inanimate objects such as barber poles, candy wrappers, clothing and furniture can communicate complex and subtle messages about people and things. As images of familiar objects are presented, a rhythmic country-rock song raises questions about the messages they carry. The viewer is encouraged to think about how objects stimulate our associations in order to communicate an idea or manipulate our responses. Images by John Seale.

results.title: Speaking in Public (I'd Rather Be in Siberia)
results.creator_credit: University of Technology, Sydney. Dept. of Production Services and Mike Barnacoat
results.brief_description: The first part of this program, presented by Mike Minehan, provides you with an overview of the skills you will need to become a successful presenter - preparation, posture, gesture, facial expression, eye contact, language, vocal skills and energy level. The second part of the program shows a highly skilled public speaker, Father Peter McGrath, giving a lecture to nursing students.

results.title: Speaking from Experience
results.brief_description: The aim of this 2-part program is to strongly promote the importance of the involvement in the mental health services of people who either are using or have used these services. Part 1 covers: “Introduction and United Kingdom Projects”. Part 2 covers: “User involvement in Holland and Conclusion”.

results.title: Speaking effectively...to one or one thousand
results.creator_credit: Sunset Films, Toastmasters International and Bert Decker
results.brief_description: Many people find public speaking to be a terrifying experience. However, this fear is a learned response. The underlying purpose of this film is to link public speaking to everyday interpersonal communication and to explain key communication factors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sunset Films, Toastmasters International and Bert Decker

results.title: Speak up, Andrew!
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Carolyn Diliberto and Don MacDonald
results.brief_description: A humorous and informative film which clearly outlines in a narrative context the factors necessary for good speech. Andrew, who suffers from a nasal problem which affects the clarity of his speech, is instructed by his teacher to speak at a parent teacher night on the importance of good speech patterns. During the days preceding the speech night, Andrew’s friends, noting his lack of confidence, coach and encourage him in the points that make up good speech making - organisation and clarity. With practice, Andrew overcomes his barriers and impresses with his newly-developed abilities. Suitable for upper primary level.
